intro: Althaea bertolae, commonly known as the Ethiopian marshmallow, is a perennial herb native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes plants like hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, fleshy stems and large, heart-shaped leaves. It produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in the summer months. Althaea bertolae is adapted to wet, marshy environments and is often found in swampy areas along rivers.
